com.ikalagaming.plugins

Class PluginManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikalagaming.plugins.PluginManager

  • public class PluginManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles loading, unloading and storage of plugins. This is considered a plugin, but is always enabled and never loaded.
    Author:
    Ches Burks

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PluginManager(EventManager evtManager)
      Constructs a new PluginManager and initializes variables.

      • PluginManager

        public PluginManager(EventManager evtManager)

    • Method Detail

      • compareVersions

        public static final int compareVersions(java.lang.String first,
                                        java.lang.String second)
        Compare the order of version strings, as if using first.compareTo(second). This should be string semantic versions and can handle build info and the like but build metadata is ignored. For example, compareVersions("1.0.0-rc.1+build.1", "1.3.7+build.2.b8f12d7") would return a number less than 0. compareVersions("2.1.3", "1.0.1") would return a number greater than 0. compareVersions("1.0.0+build.1", "1.0.0+build.1") would return 0 because they are equal builds.
        Parameters:
        first - The first version string
        second - The second version string
        Returns:
        the value of comparing the two versions.

      • destoryInstance

        public static void destoryInstance()
        Shuts down the static instance (unregisters commands and unloads plugins) if it exists, and then nullifies the reference to it. This exists in case you wish to use your own instances of the Plugin Manager and not use the single static instance provided. If the instance does not exist, nothing happens. Note that a new static instance may be created if the instance is requested later.
        See Also:
        getInstance(), getInstance(EventManager)

      • getInstance

        public static PluginManager getInstance()
        Returns the static instance of the plugin manager. Since there should only be one of these, having a static instance is fine and any class can get the instance which all other classes should share. If there is no instance yet, one will be created.
        Returns:
        the static instance of the Plugin Manager
        See Also:
        getInstance(EventManager), destoryInstance()

      • getInstance

        public static PluginManager getInstance(EventManager manager)
        Returns the static instance of the plugin manager. Since there should only be one of these, having a static instance is fine and any class can get the instance which all other classes should share. If there is no instance yet, one will be created.
        Parameters:
        manager - the event manager to use for the static instance
        Returns:
        the static instance of the Plugin Manager
        See Also:
        getInstance(), destoryInstance()

      • isNewerVersion

        public static final boolean isNewerVersion(java.lang.String toCheck,
                                           java.lang.String existing)
        Returns true if the first string is a strictly newer version than the second, where both are semantic version strings. For example, isNewerVersion("1.2.3", "0.0.1") returns true. isNewerVersion("1.0.0+build.1", "1.0.2") returns false. isNewerVersion("1.0.0+build.1", "1.0.0") returns false because it is the same.
        Parameters:
        toCheck - The string that is unknown relative to the known version.
        existing - The existing version that is known but could be outdated.
        Returns:
        true if the first version is newer than the second, otherwise false.

      • logAlert

        void logAlert(java.lang.String whichAlert,
              Plugin plugin)
        Log an alert about a plugin lifecycle, where plugin name and version are automatically replaced.
        Parameters:
        whichAlert - The string to read from the resource bundle
        plugin - The plugin that the alert is about

        Parameters:

      • containsCommand

        Returns true if the array contains the given string.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the string exists

      • disable

        public boolean disable(Plugin target)
        Deactivates the plugin and halts all of its operations. The plugin is still loaded in memory but not active. Calls Plugin.onDisable(). This changes the plugin state to DISABLING. The plugin state is changed to DISABLED after completion. If Plugin.onDisable() returns false (failed), the plugin state is set to CORRUPTED.
        Parameters:
        target - the plugin to disable
        Returns:
        true if the plugin has been successfully disabled, false if there was a problem

      • disable

        public boolean disable(java.lang.String target)
        Deactivates the plugin and halts all of its operations. The plugin is still loaded in memory but not active. Calls Plugin.onDisable(). This changes the plugins state to DISABLING. The plugin state is changed to DISABLED after completion. If Plugin.onDisable() returns false (failed), the plugin state is set to CORRUPTED.
        Parameters:
        target - the name of the plugin to disable
        Returns:
        true if the plugin has been successfully disabled, false if there was a problem

      • enable

        public boolean enable(Plugin target)
        Activates the plugin and enables it to perform its normal functions. Calls Plugin.onEnable(). This changes the plugin state to ENABLING. The plugin state is changed to ENABLED after completion. If Plugin.onEnable() returns false (failed), the plugin state is set to CORRUPTED.
        Parameters:
        target - The plugin to enable
        Returns:
        true if the plugin was successfully enabled, false if there was a problem

      • enable

        public boolean enable(java.lang.String target)
        Activates the plugin and enables it to perform its normal functions. Calls Plugin.onEnable(). This changes the plugin state to ENABLING. The plugin state is changed to ENABLED after completion. If Plugin.onEnable() returns false (failed), the plugin state is set to CORRUPTED.
        Parameters:
        target - The name of the plugin to enable
        Returns:
        true if the plugin was successfully enabled, false if there was a problem

      • enableOnLoad

        public boolean enableOnLoad()
        Returns true if this plugin manager automatically enables plugins when they are loaded. If they are not enabled on load, they must be enabled manually after being loaded.
        Returns:
        true if the plugins enable after loading, false if they must be manually enabled
        See Also:
        setEnableOnLoad(boolean)

      • extractPluginInfo

        public java.util.Optional<PluginInfo> extractPluginInfo(java.io.File jar)
        Load up the plugin info from the given jar file and return it. If there is some error like the file not actually being a jar or plugin info missing, then the returned optional is empty.
        Parameters:
        jar - the jar to load info from.
        Returns:
        an optional containing the plugin info, or an empty optional on failure.

      • fireEvent

        public boolean fireEvent(Event event)
        Fires an event with a message to a plugin type from the plugin manager. If an error occurs, this will return false. The event should not have been sent if false was returned.
        Parameters:
        event - the event to fire
        Returns:
        true if the event was fired correctly

      • getCommandParent

        public java.lang.String getCommandParent(java.lang.String s)
        Returns the plugin that registered the given string, or null if it cannot be found.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to look for
        Returns:
        the owner of the command

      • getCommands

        public java.util.ArrayList<PluginCommand> getCommands()
        Returns a clone of the commands list.
        Returns:
        a copy of the stored list

      • getInfo

        public java.util.Optional<PluginInfo> getInfo(Plugin target)
        Get the plugin info for a given plugin. If no info exists for the specified plugin, an empty optinal is returned.
        Parameters:
        target - The plugin to get info from.
        Returns:
        The info for the specified plugin.

      • getLoadedPlugins

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Plugin> getLoadedPlugins()
        Returns the map of plugin name to Plugin of the currently loaded plugins.
        Returns:
        the plugin map

      • getPlugin

        public java.util.Optional<Plugin> getPlugin(java.lang.String type)
        If a plugin of the given type exists (isLoaded(String)), then the plugin that is of that type is returned. Otherwise, an empty optional is returned.
        Parameters:
        type - The plugin type
        Returns:
        The Plugin with the given type

      • getPluginState

        public PluginState getPluginState(Plugin target)
        Returns the current state of the plugin.
        Parameters:
        target - The plugin to fetch the state of
        Returns:
        a PluginState representing the status of this plugin

      • getResourceBundle

        public java.util.ResourceBundle getResourceBundle()
        Returns the resource bundle for the plugin manager. This is not safe and could be null.
        Returns:
        the current resource bundle

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled(Plugin target)
        Returns true if the plugin is enabled, and false otherwise. A state of ENABLED returns true, any other states will return false. Plugins that are not loaded will return false.
        Parameters:
        target - The plugin to check for enabled status
        Returns:
        true if the plugin is fully ready to operate

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled(java.lang.String target)
        Returns true if the plugin is enabled, and false otherwise. A state of ENABLED returns true, any other states will return false. Plugins that are not loaded will return false.
        Parameters:
        target - The name of plugin to check for enabled status
        Returns:
        true if the plugin is fully ready to operate

      • isLoaded

        public boolean isLoaded(Plugin type)
        Returns true if a plugin exists that has the same type as the provided plugin (for example: "Graphics").
        Parameters:
        type - the plugin type
        Returns:
        true if the plugin is loaded in memory, false if it does not exist

      • isLoaded

        public boolean isLoaded(java.lang.String type)
        Returns true if a plugin exists with the given type (for example: "Graphics")'
        Parameters:
        type - the plugin type
        Returns:
        true if the plugin is loaded in memory, false if it does not exist

      • loadPlugin

        @Deprecated
public boolean loadPlugin(Plugin toLoad,
                                       PluginInfo info)
        Deprecated. This is getting phased out, all plugins will be loaded from file

        Loads the given plugin into memory, stores it by type, and enables it if plugins are enabled on load by default.

        If the type of plugin already exists in the manager, and the new plugin has a higher version number, then the old plugin is unloaded and the new one is loaded in its place. If the versions are equal, or the new plugin is older, then it does not load the new version and returns false.

        Parameters:
        toLoad - the plugin to load
        info - The plugin info to use while loading a plugin
        Returns:
        true if the plugin was loaded properly, false otherwise
        See Also:
        enableOnLoad()

      • loadPlugin

        public boolean loadPlugin(java.lang.String path,
                          java.lang.String name)
        Loads a plugin by name from a folder.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the folder containing the file
        name - the filename to load from, without a file extension
        Returns:
        true on success, false if it failed

      • registerCommand

        public boolean registerCommand(java.lang.String command,
                               Plugin owner)
        Attempts to register the command for the given class. If the command already exists, an error is logged and the method returns false.
        Parameters:
        command - the command to register
        owner - what plugin is registering the command
        Returns:
        true if the command registered successfully

      • reload

        public boolean reload(Plugin target)
        This is essentially restarting the plugins. The plugin is disabled if it is enabled, unloaded, then loaded.
        Parameters:
        target - The plugin to reload
        Returns:
        true if the plugin reloaded successfully, false otherwise

      • setEnableOnLoad

        public void setEnableOnLoad(boolean newValue)
        Sets the flag for automatically enabling plugins when they are loaded. If they are not enabled on load, they must be enabled manually after being loaded.

        This allows some customization of how the plugin system works.

        Parameters:
        newValue - true if the plugins should be automatically enabled after loading, false if they should be manually enabled

      • unloadPlugin

        public void unloadPlugin(Plugin toUnload)
        Attempts to unload the plugin from memory. Does nothing if the plugin is not loaded. Plugins are disabled before unloading. This calls unloadPlugin(String) using the plugin type.
        Parameters:
        toUnload - The type of plugin to unload

      • unloadPlugin

        public boolean unloadPlugin(java.lang.String toUnload)
        Attempts to unload the plugin from memory. If no plugin exists with the given name (isLoaded(String)), returns false and does nothing.
        Parameters:
        toUnload - The type of plugin to unload
        Returns:
        true if the plugin was unloaded properly

      • unregisterCommand

        public boolean unregisterCommand(java.lang.String command)
        Unregisters the given command.
        Parameters:
        command - the command to remove
        Returns:
        true if the command was removed

      • unregisterPluginCommands

        public void unregisterPluginCommands(Plugin owner)
        Removes all commands that the given plugin registered.
        Parameters:
        owner - the plugin which is having commands removed
